title: What is the exact meaning of the song “Hotel California” & its album cover image? - Quora

response.answer_text: The meaning of the song Hotel California, I believe, is deliberately ambiguous. That being said, there are several possibilities of how the song can be reasonably inferred. The first, and in my opinion the most likely, translation of the lyrics is that the Hotel California is a brothel. Lyrics that allude to the addiction of sex and love can be found throughout the song. “Mirrors on the ceiling, the pink champagne on ice; and she said, ‘we are all just prisoners here of our own device.’ In the master’s chambers, they gather for the feast. They stab it with their steely knives but they just can’t kill the beast.” This is to say, all persons in the Hotel California, whether the ladies or the Johns, are enslaved to an insatiable lust that leaves them ever wanting more.The protagonist in the story went to hell. For this alternative, we may consider, “I heard the mission bell.” It was a warning from God not to descend down a wicked, sinful path, or not to open Pandora’s box. He would find himself being led down a dark tunnel, lured by hedonism and camaraderie, that would quickly wear off.The character experienced drug addiction. Most supportive of this theory is, “You can check out anytime you like, but you can never leave.” He can stop using, but he can never kill the desire to use more once he has done so. Moreover, “‘Relax’, said the night man, ‘We are programmed to receive’”, which precedes it, suggests that there is an entity within this addictive force whose interest lies in keeping him there.Whichever of these options you prefer, they are all about a dark addiction that is seemingly alluring, but is in fact an insidious trap that you will soon find you questioning the wisdom of your choices.
